His language abilities, shown in various episodes, include French, Spanish, Italian, and others. Throughout the first three seasons, his code name was BoyScout; from season four on, it was Shotgun. Executive producer Sallie Patrick said that with Michael and Carrington butler Anders, "we introduce the theme of upstairs/downstairs, because how can you have a show about the filthy rich without including the people who try their damnedest to keep them clean?" Carrington chauffeur Michael Culhane (Robert Christopher Riley) is also Fallon\'s lover and unofficial', 'Document 3 (Title: Michael Vartan): "Rogue", and starred in the film "Jolene" in 2008. Vartan\'s most notable role to date has been as Michael Vaughn in the American television series "Alias" (2001–2006). He played the role of Lancelot in TNT\'s production of Marion Zimmer Bradley\'s "The Mists of Avalon" (2001). Vartan has also had guest appearances on "Friends" (as Dr. Tim Burke, Tom Selleck\'s character\'s son) and "Ally McBeal" (as Jonathan Basset). He also appeared on the show "Kitchen Confidential", which starred his former "Alias" co-star Bradley Cooper, as a French chef who was Cooper\'s rival. In September 2007, Vartan played James Walker, a main', 'Document 4 (Title: Paul Wesley): Paul Wesley Paweł Tomasz Wasilewski (; born July 23, 1982), known professionally as Paul Wesley and formerly as Paul Wasilewski, is an American actor, director, and producer. He is best known for his roles as Aaron Corbett in the miniseries "Fallen", Stefan Salvatore on the supernatural drama series "The Vampire Diaries", and as Eddie Longo on the anthology series "Tell Me a Story". Wesley was born in New Brunswick, New Jersey, to Polish parents Tomasz and Agnieszka Wasilewski, and grew up in Marlboro Township, New Jersey. He has one older sister, Monika Emara (née Wasilewski), and two younger sisters, Leah', 'Document 5 (Title: Sebastian Gregory): The band was later taken to London by Xenomania and they were offered a recording contract. Gregory\'s acting talent was discovered after he was spotted in his own music video. He was then signed to an acting management agency. Gregory has appeared in a number of short films, commercials, theatre, television productions and films. In 2004, he appeared as Rohan Shanley in an episode of "Blue Heelers". Two years later Gregory landed a recurring role in the long-running soap opera "Neighbours". He played Garrett Burns, a love interest for Rachel Kinski (Caitlin Stasey). Gregory made his feature film debut in']
